title: black screen instead of loading screen after champ. select
body:
hey guys,
i'm missing out on urf and ranked games coz of this stupid problem -.- this happened to me in a ranked game; where champion select finishes, but i never get taken to the loading game screen with the rest of the players. instead, a black screen shows up. then if i cancel to retry the connection, i get taken to the reconnect screen on the client. strange thing is, this only happens on my wifi. i can play normally on my friend's wifi. nothing has been changed with the wifi. i've tried turning all firewalls off. idk what to do. riot support was hopeless.
any help is appreciated
thx

replies.body:
What a generic message. That only happens if your connection is cut as you're connecting, ie. you pull out the plug or something.

But obviously that's not the case. By chance, it could be a software on your computer that's doing it. Have you tried seeing if your internet entirely cuts out as the game tries to connect?

If you've confirmed that your internet is fine as you're connecting, then look over [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) and troubleshoot. Remember that some need you to restart your computer. If you're having trouble with anything on their, just tell me and I can help you with it.

Best of luck.

i don't think it's related to patches. or u might not have the same problem as me @mattithias have u tried playing on another wifi? it works for me on another 1; sadly this only happens on my wifi....
i havn't changed anything with my modem router
Use 'Reply' on his comment or he won't get notification of it.

I've been having the same problem as well since yesterday. Got into one game after like 10-15 mins after closing my client and re-opening but it hasn't worked since. Tried everything that League support pages ask you to try and even looked at youtube and reddit threads about things to try. Nothings changed on my end before this started happening, did a patch get released recently?
was just told how to reply, lol *facepalm*. check below for reply
btw this also sometimes shows up. helppppppppp :/
Have you tried the page I linked you to yet?
ya + turned all firewalls off (avast+windows) this is getting frustrating and just plain stupid

So you tried turning off IPv6, using Google's DNS and using a wired connection?

Try this: Go into Internet Options (accessible from the control panel) and change all settings to their defaults. Then, go to the "Security" tab and change the level to "Medium-Low", the lowest possible option.
